intro: Wurmbea nilpinna, commonly known as the mountain yellow flag, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
